permafrost.tundra.id

Class IntegerID

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.id.IntegerID

  • public class IntegerID
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a time-based algorithm for generating integer IDs. The IDs generated are lexically ordered by time, and fit within the bounds of a positive signed 32-bit integer.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit DEFAULT_TIME_UNIT
      The default time unit used to generate IDs.
      private long epoch
      The epoch from which time is measured.
      private int partition
      The value used to partition the ID space.
      private int partitionBitLength
      The number of bits used for partitioning the ID space.
      private long previous
      The previously generated ID's time component, used to ensure only one ID is generated per second.
      private int timeDivisor
      The divisor used to calculate the time component of the ID (time % divisor).
      private java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit
      The unit of time used for calculating the time component of the ID.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntegerID()
      Constructs a new ID generator using 31 bits of time measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.
      IntegerID(int partitionBitLength, int partition)
      Constructs a new ID generator using the given number of bits for the partition component, the remaining number of bits from 31 for the time component with time measured from Unix epoch in seconds.
      IntegerID(long epoch, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Constructs a new ID generator using 31 bits of time since the given epoch in the given time unit.
      IntegerID(long epoch, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit, int partitionBitLength, int partition)
      Constructs a new ID generator using the given number of bits for the partition component, the remaining number of bits from 31 for the time component with time measured from the given epoch in the given time unit.
      IntegerID(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Constructs a new ID generator using 31 bits of time measured in the given time unit since the Unix epoch.
      IntegerID(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit, int partitionBitLength, int partition)
      Constructs a new ID generator using the given number of bits for the partition component, the remaining number of bits from 31 for the time component with time measured from Unix epoch in the given time unit.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private long currentTime()
      Returns the current time since this generator's epoch in this generator's time unit.
      int generate()
      Returns a newly generated ID.
      private int generate(long time)
      Returns a new ID given a time value.
